data.title: Harvard Physics Student Awards
data.meta_description: Gertrude and Maurice Goldhaber Prize  This prize is awarded annually to the outstanding theoretical and experimental graduate students who have passed their qualifying oral examinations in the preceding year.  List of Winners
data.text:
Gertrude and Maurice Goldhaber Prize

This prize is awarded annually to the outstanding theoretical and experimental graduate students who have passed their qualifying oral examinations in the preceding year.

List of Winners

Merit Scholarship

The Harvard Merit/Term Time Research Awards are available to outstanding GSAS students in all fields, including GSAS departments in the natural sciences. These fellowships are normally to be held in the fourth or fifth year, or earlier, and are for the purpose of allowing the students to devote a greater portion of their time to research, fieldwork, and writing than would otherwise be possible if they have a heavy teaching load or other employment. Students must have passed Generals and have an approved dissertation prospectus at the time of nomination, or be scheduled to have approval by the time the award begins (the award otherwise will be forfeited if approval does not materialize).

List of Winners

Carol Davis Prize

Awarded to a Physics concentrator in recognition of their efforts to build a more inclusive and welcoming environment in the Physics Department.

Recent winners:

YEAR STUDENT RECIPIENTS CITATION 2024 Mincheol Park "for his work as an exceptional Course Assistant who goes above and beyond to support his peers. And, his work as the Chair of Chilloquium, a series of weekly moderated conversations between students and experienced career physicists, to expand the networks of our Physics community." 2024 Emma Weller "for her exceptional dedication to SPS and the Physics community. Emma is a diligent and consistent member of the SPS Events and Panels team who does not hesitate to get involved and show her community spirit. Countless students have benefited from poundages of pumpkins tossed out the window and gallons of LN ice-cream served." 2024 Victoria Zhang, Qijia Zhou "for their work as the Co-Presidents of the Society of Physics students to bring the community together through various fun and creative programs, while sharing their love of physics with the greater Harvard community. Thanks to their efforts, the Harvard chapter of SPS was awarded the Distinguished Chapter of the Year award for 2022-2023." 2023 Ilona Demler "for her work with Undergraduate Women in Physics (WiP) to encourage women and underrepresented students to explore Physics" 2022 Denisse Cordova Carrizales "for creating and leading the Primus group for first generation and low income students."

David J. Robbins Prize

From the income of a fund was established in 1956 by Dr. and Mrs. Milton E. Robbins in memory of their son, David J. Robbins, A.B. 1955. The purpose of the prize is to enable recipients to enjoy the cultural activities and recreation that enriched David J. Robbins' short life.

Recent winners:

YEAR STUDENT RECIPIENTS CITATION 2023 Rodrigo Araiza Bravo

In recognition of his outreach work and recruitment efforts at the annual Society for Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics & Native Americans in Science Conferences since 2020

2023 Noah Toyonaga In recognition of his efforts to bring a peer-led bystander and Title IX training "Respect is Part of Research" to Harvard as part of the G1 Orientation in 2020 and 2021 2023 Justina Yang In recognition of her work on the Physics Department's Equity and Inclusion Committee and the APS Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity Alliance 2022 Cari Cesarotti and Erin Crawley "in recognition of their outstanding work in developing and teaching the new "Physics Foundations" prep course. The course has become a valuable component of the department's efforts to welcome newcomers into physics regardless of their prior background." 2021 Taylor Contreras, Katie Fraser, and Madelyn Leembruggen "in recognition of their outstanding chairship of Women in Physics as well as their outstanding conceptualization and leadership of the Building Inclusive Community workshops hosted in 2019 and 2020" 2021 Grace Pan and Grace Zhang

"in recognition of their outstanding organization and leadership of the two-day workshop "Factors Leading to Success in Science" as part of the department’s teaching practicum course"

2020 LaNell Williams "in recognition of [her] outstanding conceptualization and leadership of the Women+ of Color Project that hosted an inaugural workshop in 2019" 2019 Christie Chiu, Ellen Klein, and Anne Hébert "in recognition of [their] outstanding organization of the 2017 CUWIP and SPIN-UP Conferences as well as [their]leadership in rebuilding and reinvigorating the Women in Physics group within the department"

Jack T. Sanderson Memorial Prize in Physics

From the gift of family, friends, and colleagues in memory of Jack T. Sanderson '58, A.M. '67, an annual prize is awarded to the graduating senior with the highest grade point average in Physics.

List of Winners

White Teaching Prize

The White Prize is awarded by the Physics Department for excellence in teaching introductory courses.

List of Winners
